get.description: Run google search and get the information.

parameters.name: lowRange
parameters.description: The lower bound of a range. Use lowRange and highRange to append an inclusive search range of lowRange...highRange to the query.

parameters.name: highRange
parameters.description: The upper bound of a range. Use lowRange and highRange to append an inclusive search range of lowRange...highRange to the query.

parameters.name: num
parameters.description: The number of search results to return. The maximum value is 10.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sorting expression to be applied to the results. The sorting parameter specifies how to sort the results based on the specified expression, such as sorting by date. Example: sort=date.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: The index of the first result to return. The default number of results per page is 10, so &start=11 will start from the top of the second page of results. Note: The JSON API will never return more than 100 results, even if there are more than 100 documents that match the query, so setting the sum of start + num to a number greater than 100 will also result in an error. Also, note that the maximum value for num is 10.
